title: Buckner resident dies as result of accidental shooting
content:
The owner of a lawn care service in Magnolia died as the result of an accidental shooting at his home in Buckner on Monday night.
The Lafayette County Sheriff’s Office responded at 11:20 p.m. to a 911 call about a shooting at 1180 Lafayette 4.
When officers arrived they found Mike Smith lying in the hallway of his home. He was transported to Magnolia Regional Medical Center where he was pronounced dead.
All indications lead to an accidental shooting when a revolver fell out of a gun safe and discharged, striking Smith in the chest, the sheriff’s office said in a statement.
The case was investigated by the Lafayette County Sheriff’s Office with assistance from Arkansas State Police.
Smith was the owner of Smith Lawn Care. His wife, Glenda Smith, is assistant principal at Magnolia Junior High School. Additional survivors are three daughters, Morgan, Lauren and Kristin Smith, all of Buckner; one son, Camden Smith of Buckner; his parents, Danny and Janice Smith; one brother, Donald Smith and wife Tammie of Waldo; his father-in-law, James Mac Allen of Stamps; and other nieces, nephews and friends and relatives.
Funeral services will be at 4 p.m. Saturday at the Lafayette County High School Gymnasium in Stamps. Burial will follow at Liberty Cemetery in Stamps.
Visitation will be 6-8 p.m. Friday at Smith Funeral Home in Stamps.
